plyranges

    • Using plyranges to perform common genomic data wrangling tasks

Disjoin then aggregate a Ranges object

Disjoin then aggregate a Ranges object

disjoin_ranges(.data, ...)

disjoin_ranges_directed(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

a Ranges object to disjoin
...

Name-value pairs of summary functions.

Value

a Ranges object with the

Examples

df <- data.frame(start = 1:10, width = 5,  seqnames = "seq1",
strand = sample(c("+", "-", "*"), 10, replace = TRUE), gc = runif(10))
rng <- as_granges(df)
rng %>% disjoin_ranges()
#> GRanges object with 14 ranges and 0 metadata columns:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle>
#>    [1]     seq1    [1, 1]      *
#>    [2]     seq1    [2, 2]      *
#>    [3]     seq1    [3, 3]      *
#>    [4]     seq1    [4, 4]      *
#>    [5]     seq1    [5, 5]      *
#>    ...      ...       ...    ...
#>   [10]     seq1  [10, 10]      *
#>   [11]     seq1  [11, 11]      *
#>   [12]     seq1  [12, 12]      *
#>   [13]     seq1  [13, 13]      *
#>   [14]     seq1  [14, 14]      *
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
rng %>% disjoin_ranges(gc = mean(gc))
#> GRanges object with 14 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand |                gc
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> |         <numeric>
#>    [1]     seq1    [1, 1]      * | 0.463701178086922
#>    [2]     seq1    [2, 2]      * |  0.55540118610952
#>    [3]     seq1    [3, 3]      * | 0.690458488107348
#>    [4]     seq1    [4, 4]      * | 0.686943408974912
#>    [5]     seq1    [5, 5]      * | 0.638584331516176
#>    ...      ...       ...    ... .               ...
#>   [10]     seq1  [10, 10]      * | 0.439672503434122
#>   [11]     seq1  [11, 11]      * | 0.460147183563095
#>   [12]     seq1  [12, 12]      * | 0.461619092694794
#>   [13]     seq1  [13, 13]      * | 0.469721650588326
#>   [14]     seq1  [14, 14]      * | 0.694350712001324
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
rng %>% disjoin_ranges_directed(gc = mean(gc))
#> GRanges object with 15 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand |                gc
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> |         <numeric>
#>    [1]     seq1    [1, 1]      + | 0.463701178086922
#>    [2]     seq1    [2, 2]      + |  0.55540118610952
#>    [3]     seq1    [3, 3]      + | 0.690458488107348
#>    [4]     seq1    [4, 5]      + | 0.686943408974912
#>    [5]     seq1    [6, 6]      + | 0.660461560182739
#>    ...      ...       ...    ... .               ...
#>   [11]     seq1  [12, 12]      + | 0.569882344454527
#>   [12]     seq1  [13, 14]      + | 0.694350712001324
#>   [13]     seq1  [ 5,  8]      - | 0.445148021681234
#>   [14]     seq1  [ 9,  9]      - | 0.345120305428281
#>   [15]     seq1  [10, 13]      - | 0.245092589175329
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths
